item.title: Famitsu Sales: 12/1/25 – 12/7/25
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Octopath Traveler 0 debuts at 59,314 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of December 1, 2025 to December 7, 2025.

Octopath Traveler 0 was the highest selling new release of the week, debuting at 21,698 units on Switch, 19,533 units on PlayStation 5, and 18,083 units on Switch 2 for an opening week total of at least 59,314 retail copies sold. The PlayStation 4 version did not chart in the top 10.

Metroid Prime 4: Beyond followed at 21,415 units on Switch 2. The Switch version did not chart in the top 10.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 203,398 units, the Switch family sold 51,316 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 25,240 units, the Xbox Series family sold 231 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 20 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 102,435 (2,354,146)
  2. [SW2] Kirby Air Riders (Nintendo, 11/20/25) – 46,737 (288,618)
  3. [SW2] Pokemon Legends: Z-A – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 44,331 (862,377)
  4. [NSW] Pokemon Legends: Z-A (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 40,441 (1,347,242)
  5. [NSW] Octopath Traveler 0 (Square Enix, 12/04/25) – 21,698 (New)
  6. [SW2] Metroid Prime 4: Beyond – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Nintendo, 12/04/25) – 21,415 (New)
  7. [SW2] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Konami, 11/13/25) – 19,806 (113,094)
  8. [PS5] Octopath Traveler 0 (Square Enix, 12/04/25) – 19,533 (New)
  9. [SW2] Octopath Traveler 0 (Square Enix, 12/04/25) – 18,083 (New)
  10. [NSW] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen (Konami, 11/13/25) – 17,851 (158,992)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on December 12.

  1. [PS5] Octopath Traveler 0 (Square Enix, 12/04/25) – (New)

item.title: Delisted Psikyo shoot ’em ups for PC to return via rights holder KM-BOX
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Gunbird, Samurai Aces, and Strikers 1945 due out on December 16.

The PC versions of the 12 Psikyo shoot ’em up titles that were delisted from Steam on October 31 will return via rights holder KM-BOX, the company confirmed to Gematsu.

KM-BOX, a South Korean publisher, has held the rights to the Psikyo library since the early 2000s. It granted City Connection the rights to publish the PC versions of these titles for a period of time, but reclaimed those rights as of those year and will now handle those releases directly.

The following three titles are due out on December 16:

  • Gunbird
  • Samurai Aces
  • Strikers 1945

And the following titles will follow at a later date:

  • Gunbird 2
  • Gunbarich
  • Dragon Blaze
  • Samurai Aces Episode II: Tengai
  • Samurai Aces Episode III: Sengoku Cannon
  • Sol Divide
  • Strikers 1945 II
  • Strikers 1945 III
  • Zero Gunner 2


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/delisted-psikyo-shoot-em-ups-for-pc-to-return-via-rights-holder-km-box
